creator: frank.paehlke@web.de
text:
If I use batik-rasterizer (1.5.1) to convert an SVG file into PDF, the output 
page size is always about 3% too large. 
 
E.g., the SVG file 
 
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="iso-8859-1"?> 
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.0//EN" 
"http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd"> 
<svg width="6in" height="4in" viewBox="0 0 600 400" preserveAspectRatio="none" 
xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"> 
<rect x="0" y="0" width="599" height="399" fill="#ffffff" stroke="#000000" 
stroke-width="1" /> 
</svg> 
 
produces output that is about 6.17 x 4.11 in tall. The same applies to other 
combinations of width/height. For someone who wants to produce graphs that 
have an exact units-per-cm correspondence, this is really a show-stopper. 
 
Regards, 
Frank Paehlke

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
This was a bug in a constant.  This has now been fixed for the
pdf-transcoder. Sorry!
